Subject: Agents Eating Software Engineering - January 20

You've probably tried 'vibe coding' with AI agents, starting strong, then hitting a wall when context and complexity grow. Michael Geiger is speaking on Monday, January 20th to show how to move past one-off prompts and orchestrate agents like Claude Code and Gas Town through real production workflows. This is for software teams ready to ship better code by applying human judgment where it actually matters.

Michael will demonstrate structured workflows covering research to align intent, planning stages, parallel implementation, and early breaking techniques. You'll see where human judgment creates the most value in agent-assisted development.

The session shows how to focus on high-leverage decisions like defining quality standards and setting constraints upfront, rather than spending time cleaning up generated code. Michael shares a practical checklist you can use immediately to identify workflow and environment gaps, helping your team ship higher-quality software faster without getting stuck in agent babysitting mode.

Reserve your spot at https://www.meetup.com/columbus-ai/events/312833823/?slug=columbus-ai&eventId=312833823 and join Michael on Monday, January 20th. Bring your toughest workflow questions and leave with actionable strategies you can apply right away.

Will 2026 be the last year you write code by hand?

Michael Geiger explains how AI agents are eating software engineering on Jan 20. Stop vibe coding and start orchestrating tools. ü§ñ

Anthropic bans using Claude Code to build competing AI dev tools. While everyone celebrates the launch, they're quietly locking developers out of building what comes next. #AI #PlatformRisk
Anthropic blocking third-party Claude Code tools isn't about terms of service. It's about AI vendors capturing your entire value chain, not just selling models. #AI #PlatformRisk
AI-generated code is changing how developers choose programming languages. Typed languages offer better safety when working with AI-written code. #AI #DevTools
IBM Bob downloaded malware through prompt injection. Everyone's rushing to ship AI agents but skipping the sandbox. Treat them as untrusted binaries, not smart helpers. #AI #security
New research shows neural networks can still learn effectively even when most training labels are wrong. This could change how we think about data quality. #AI #MachineLearning
Notion AI is leaking enterprise data through an unpatched prompt injection flaw. We obsess over hallucinations while the real risk is bolting AI onto systems without security. #AISecurity
AI is changing how teams work together in Google Workspace. New tools are making collaboration easier and more efficient for businesses. #AI #FutureOfWork
While you pilot AI copilots, agents just matched humans at hacking. The real story isn't productivity, it's that quarterly pentests are now obsolete. #AIagents #cybersecurity

Most people try to make 1 AI agent write entire emails. We use specialized agent teams instead. Counterintuitively, this produces way better results. Here's the architecture that changed everything üßµ

---

Our first attempt failed spectacularly. One agent tried to juggle subject lines, hooks, content, and CTAs all at once. The output felt robotic and generic. Quality was all over the place. Then we realized the problem wasn't the AI. It was asking it to do too much.

---

We rebuilt it as a team sport. 4 specialist agents work in parallel, each mastering one thing. A 5th agent acts as senior editor, reviewing for coherence and polish. Division of labor + quality control = consistently better output.

---

Results were immediate. Emails that took 3-5 hours now take seconds. We built it as a sub-workflow that's usable across different processes. Quality stays consistently high without manual review. That 5th agent catches what the specialists miss.

---

The takeaway is to stop asking one AI to be a generalist. Deploy specialists and add a critic for quality control. This pattern works for content, data processing, customer support, anywhere quality matters. #AIAutomation #WorkflowDesign
Tired of generic AI responses? Self-refining agents can now critique and improve their own outputs before showing you results. #AIAgents #MachineLearning
Everyone's building AI to click buttons in browsers. DeepMind and Boston Dynamics just partnered to build AI that moves your warehouse inventory instead #EmbodiedAI #AI #Robotics
Everyone's buying more VRAM for bigger KV caches. TTT-E2E just eliminated the cache entirely by making models learn as they read. #AI #LLMs #Architecture
New research shows how federated learning lets AI models train on your phone's data without ever uploading it. Privacy meets progress. #AI #FederatedLearning
Eurostar's chatbot leaked system configs. The real AI risk isn't hallucinations, it's companies skipping basic security testing on new endpoints. #AIDeployment #EnterpriseSecurity
RAG systems often fail when the answer is buried in the middle of retrieved context. The LLM finds the doc but misses the answer. Understanding this helps build better AI apps. #RAG #AI
AWS Kiro signals the shift everyone's missing. AI coding tools aren't about speed anymore. They're about writing specs while agents build the architecture. #SpecDriven #AIEngineering
IQuest-Coder claims to beat GPT-5 before it even ships. The closed-source moat is crumbling faster than anyone expected. #OpenSource #AI #Enterprise
Big context windows are just expensive workarounds. TTT architecture makes models learn during inference instead of hoarding tokens in memory. Linear scaling vs quadratic costs. #AI #LLM
AI video tools are moving past just looking good. The next step is creating structured, cinematic content that actually tells a story. #AIVideo #GenerativeAI
AI labs are building nuclear plants because the grid can't keep up. Your AI strategy isn't just about models anymore, it's also about electricity. #AI #Infrastructure
Is English becoming the new programming language? Developers are now spending more time describing what they want than writing code. #AI #NoCode
Static code is fading as AI transforms how developers work. A quiet shift is reshaping workflows across the industry. #AI #DevOps
VSCode just rebranded as an AI code editor. The AI-native IDE startups bet Microsoft was too slow to pivot. Turns out distribution beats features. #AIcoding #devtools
That 70% AI productivity boost? Most companies aren't seeing it. The real killer is verification tax - the hidden hours spent checking AI work that erase the speed gains. #AI #ProductivityMyth
Better AI responses start with better prompts. Structure matters when working with ChatGPT, Claude, and other tools. Small changes make a big difference. #AIPrompting #DevTools
AI agents don't need shiny new architectures. A team just built one inside a 7-year-old Rails monolith. That's where your business logic lives anyway. #AIAgents #LegacySystems #EnterpriseAI
Edge AI is moving from labs to actual farms. New research shows how farmers are using AI for real-world decisions on efficiency and sustainability. #EdgeAI #AgTech
Everyone wants smarter AI. But CTOs need provably correct AI. New research shows how to mathematically verify LLM outputs before they hit production. #EnterpriseAI #AIVerification
New research shows AI can learn to read street signs and text in images using only synthetic data, no real photos needed. A breakthrough for computer vision. #AI #MachineLearning
New guide shows how to build enterprise RAG systems using Amazon Bedrock Agents with Red Hat OpenShift AI. Practical look at production AI infrastructure #AIEngineering #RAG
Salesforce fired 4000 people to save money with AI. Now they admit it was a mistake. Turns out institutional knowledge costs more to lose than payroll saves. #AI #EnterpriseAI
Nvidia just spent $20B on Groq. That's not a flex, it's an admission that GPUs aren't fast enough for real-time AI agents. The inference war just ended. #AI #MLOps
Meta's Chief AI Scientist Yann LeCun shares advice for students entering AI. His guidance focuses on building strong fundamentals in the field. #AI #MachineLearning
